node.excerpt: Background The defeat of two big real-estate projects within a 20-month span leaves New Yorkers wondering how to create jobs without gentrifying the Big Apple. In September, a plan to rezone Brooklyn's industrial waterfront into retail, academic and commercial space fell through. Progressives put u…

Facebook on August 3 agreed to lease all the office space in the mammoth 107-year-old James A. Farley Building in Midtown Manhattan, cementing New York City as a growing global technology hub and reaffirming a major corporation’s commitment to an office-centric urban culture despite the pandemic.
